title: It is far better to be alone, than to be in bad company.
author: George Washington

title: If you are lonely when you're alone, you are in bad company.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

title: The strongest man in the world is he who stands most alone.
author: Henrik Ibsen

title: Loneliness adds beauty to life. It puts a special burn on sunsets and makes night air smell better.
author: Henry Rollins

title: If you make friends with yourself you will never be alone.
author: Maxwell Maltz

title: Loneliness is the poverty of self; solitude is the richness of self.
author: May Sarton

title: You come into the world alone and you go out of the world alone yet it seems to me you are more alone while living than even going and coming.
author: Emily Carr

title: The time you feel lonely is the time you most need to be by yourself.
author: Douglas Coupland

title: Every man is born as many men and dies as a single one.
author: Martin Heidegger

title: All men's miseries derive from not being able to sit in a quiet room alone.
author: Blaise Pascal

title: Solitude vivifies; isolation kills.
author: Joseph Roux

title: The longer one is alone, the easier it is to hear the song of the earth.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

title: Let your mind alone, and see what happens.
author: Virgil Thomson

title: A man is born alone and dies alone; and he experiences the good and bad consequences of his karma alone; and he goes alone to hell or the Supreme abode.
author: Chanakya

title: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you're alone with.
author: Wayne Dyer

title: What a lovely surprise to finally discover how unlonely being alone can be.
author: Ellen Burstyn

title: I restore myself when I'm alone.
author: Marilyn Monroe

title: As I get older I'm more and more comfortable being alone.
author: Sienna Miller

title: It's better to be unhappy alone than unhappy with someone - so far.
author: Marilyn Monroe

title: To live alone is the fate of all great souls.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

title: Loneliness is my least favorite thing about life. The thing that I'm most worried about is just being alone without anybody to care for or someone who will care for me.
author: Anne Hathaway

title: We are all sentenced to solitary confinement inside our own skins, for life.
author: Tennessee Williams

title: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.
author: Helen Keller

title: Yes, I guess you could say I am a loner, but I feel more lonely in a crowed room with boring people than I feel on my own.
author: Henry Rollins

title: I never said, 'I want to be alone.' I only said, 'I want to be left alone.' There is all the difference.
author: Greta Garbo

title: It is better to be alone than in bad company.
author: George Washington

title: Look at the sky. We are not alone. The whole universe is friendly to us and conspires only to give the best to those who dream and work.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

title: When everything is lonely I can be my best friend.
author: Conor Oberst

title: To go out with the setting sun on an empty beach is to truly embrace your solitude.
author: Jeanne Moreau

title: In solitude the mind gains strength and learns to lean upon itself.
author: Laurence Sterne

title: The best part about being alone is that you really don't have to answer to anybody. You do what you want.
author: Justin Timberlake

title: When the people you love are gone, you're alone.
author: Keanu Reeves

title: Associate with men of good quality if you esteem your own reputation; for it is better to be alone than in bad company.
author: George Washington

title: I only go out to get me a fresh appetite for being alone.
author: Lord Byron

title: I would rather be a beggar and single than a queen and married.
author: Elizabeth I

title: Pray that your loneliness may spur you into finding something to live for, great enough to die for.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

title: Inside myself is a place where I live all alone and that is where I renew my springs that never dry up.
author: Pearl S. Buck

title: Every man must do two things alone; he must do his own believing and his own dying.
author: Martin Luther

title: Moon! Moon! I am prone before you. Pity me, and drench me in loneliness.
author: Amy Lowell

title: Life could be wonderful if people would leave you alone.
author: Charlie Chaplin

title: Then stirs the feeling infinite, so felt In solitude, where we are least alone.
author: Lord Byron

title: When so many are lonely as seem to be lonely, it would be inexcusably selfish to be lonely alone.
author: Tennessee Williams

title: If you're going to put yourself above everybody else, you might end up alone.
author: Joseph Gordon-Levitt

title: All men's misfortunes spring from their hatred of being alone.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

title: A man can be himself only so long as he is alone, and if he does not love solitude, he will not love freedom, for it is only when he is alone that he is really free.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

title: I have so many different personalities in me and I still feel lonely.
author: Tori Amos

title: Solitude is independence.
author: Hermann Hesse

title: To be adult is to be alone.
author: Jean Rostand

title: You only grow when you are alone.
author: Paul Newman

title: I like my life alone. I mean, I love being with friends, and I love kissing and loving someone to pieces. But it's hard to find someone who doesn't ultimately start judging you and your choices.
author: Sarah Silverman

title: The eternal quest of the individual human being is to shatter his loneliness.
author: Norman Cousins

title: There's a tremendous difference between alone and lonely. You could be lonely in a group of people. I like being alone. I like eating by myself. I go home at night and just watch a movie or hang out with my dog. I have to exert myself and really say, oh God, I've got to see my friends 'cause I'm too content being by myself.
author: Drew Barrymore

title: Living alone makes it harder to find someone to blame.
author: Mason Cooley

title: I may climb perhaps to no great heights, but I will climb alone.
author: Cyrano de Bergerac

title: I finally faced the fact that it isn't a crime not having friends. Being alone means you have fewer problems.
author: Whitney Houston

title: Don't go away. I don't want to be alone. I can't stand being alone.
author: Arnold Rothstein

title: He never is alone that is accompanied with noble thoughts.
author: John Fletcher

title: The lonely become either thoughtful or empty.
author: Mason Cooley

title: I don't want to be alone, I want to be left alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

title: I'm not interested in dating. I like being with my own best friend, me. Certain women, particularly older women, cannot believe I like going to a social event by myself. But I do.
author: Gloria Allred

title: When I'm alone, I can sleep crossways in bed without an argument.
author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

title: Nothing makes us so lonely as our secrets.
author: Paul Tournier

title: If I am a legend, then why am I so lonely?
author: Judy Garland

title: I was never less alone than when by myself.
author: Edward Gibbon

title: You're only lonely if you're not there for you.
author: Phil McGraw

title: Solitude is the profoundest fact of the human condition. Man is the only being who knows he is alone.
author: Octavio Paz

title: As a body everyone is single, as a soul never.
author: Hermann Hesse

title: Who knows what true loneliness is - not the conventional word but the naked terror? To the lonely themselves it wears a mask. The most miserable outcast hugs some memory or some illusion.
author: Joseph Conrad

title: Your actions, and your action alone, determines your worth.
author: Evelyn Waugh

title: I paint self-portraits because I am so often alone, because I am the person I know best.
author: Frida Kahlo

title: Even in the presence of others he was completely alone.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

title: The only real progress lies in learning to be wrong all alone.
author: Albert Camus

title: It is very easy to love alone.
author: Gertrude Stein

title: Language... has created the word 'loneliness' to express the pain of being alone. And it has created the word 'solitude' to express the glory of being alone.
author: Paul Tillich

title: I want to be with those who know secret things or else alone.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

title: Is he alone who has courage on his right hand and faith on his left hand?
author: Charles Lindbergh

title: We are rarely proud when we are alone.
author: Voltaire

title: The Lord had the wonderful advantage of being able to work alone.
author: Kofi Annan

title: Being alone is very difficult.
author: Yoko Ono

title: I've also seen that great men are often lonely. This is understandable, because they have built such high standards for themselves that they often feel alone. But that same loneliness is part of their ability to create.
author: Yousuf Karsh

title: All of our unhappiness comes from our inability to be alone.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

title: I think the greatest amount of pressure is the pressure I place on myself. So in a way I chose to be alone.
author: Cathy Freeman

title: A human being is a single being. Unique and unrepeatable.
author: Eileen Caddy

title: I'm fascinated with myself and love hearing the sound of my own voice. I'd like to hear what I have to say. A lot of people don't like being alone because they truly don't like themselves, but I love me.
author: Gene Simmons

title: We are for the most part more lonely when we go abroad among men than when we stay in our chambers. A man thinking or working is always alone, let him be where he will.
author: Henry David Thoreau

title: Be able to be alone. Lose not the advantage of solitude, and the society of thyself.
author: Thomas Browne

title: The capacity for not feeling lonely can carry a very real price, that of feeling nothing at all.
author: Douglas Coupland

title: I'm single, footloose and fancy free, I have no responsibilities, no anchors. Work, friendship and self-improvement, that's me.
author: Joel Edgerton

title: Still and all, why bother? Here's my answer. Many people need desperately to receive this message: I feel and think much as you do, care about many of the things you care about, although most people do not care about them. You are not alone.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

title: It is strange to be known so universally and yet to be so lonely.
author: Albert Einstein

title: To dare to live alone is the rarest courage; since there are many who had rather meet their bitterest enemy in the field, than their own hearts in their closet.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

title: If it's true that our species is alone in the universe, then I'd have to say the universe aimed rather low and settled for very little.
author: George Carlin

title: It's often just enough to be with someone. I don't need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You're not alone.
author: Marilyn Monroe

title: I would be married, but I'd have no wife, I would be married to a single life.
author: Charles Bukowski

title: Remember we're all in this alone.
author: Lily Tomlin

title: Alone let him constantly meditate in solitude on that which is salutary for his soul, for he who meditates in solitude attains supreme bliss.
author: Guru Nanak

title: We allow our ignorance to prevail upon us and make us think we can survive alone, alone in patches, alone in groups, alone in races, even alone in genders.
author: Maya Angelou

title: A man content to go to heaven alone will never go to heaven.
author: Boethius

title: In Genesis, it says that it is not good for a man to be alone; but sometimes it is a great relief.
author: John Barrymore

title: You can't fake it when you're alone with God, you know.
author: Jim Bakker

title: I have to be alone very often. I'd be quite happy if I spent from Saturday night until Monday morning alone in my apartment. That's how I refuel.
author: Audrey Hepburn

title: Unless we love and are loved, each of us is alone, each of us is deeply lonely.
author: Mortimer Adler

title: Solitude is un-American.
author: Erica Jong

title: He that can live alone resembles the brute beast in nothing, the sage in much, and God in everything.
author: Baltasar Gracian

title: There are places and moments in which one is so completely alone that one sees the world entire.
author: Jules Renard

title: I want to be alone.
author: Greta Garbo

title: The desire to get married, which - I regret to say, I believe is basic and primal in women - is followed almost immediately by an equally basic and primal urge - which is to be single again.
author: Nora Ephron

title: It's an interesting combination: Having a great fear of being alone, and having a desperate need for solitude and the solitary experience. That's always been a tug of war for me.
author: Jodie Foster

title: Only the lonely know the way I feel tonight.
author: Roy Orbison

title: I really enjoy being single again. I spent a lot of time in a relationship and the nearer we came to the end, the more difficult it got. You don't see things clearly as long as you're still involved.
author: Dido Armstrong

title: I'm very happy alone.
author: Octavia E. Butler

title: By all means use some time to be alone.
author: Edward Young

title: Absolutely lonely people have few personal interactions of any kind.
author: Martha Beck

title: I'm happily single.
author: Paula Abdul

title: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
author: Orson Welles

title: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.
author: Thomas Merton

title: Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not: nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not: the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent.
author: Calvin Coolidge

title: What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us; what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal.
author: Albert Pike

title: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

title: Laugh and the world laughs with you, snore and you sleep alone.
author: Anthony Burgess

title: Down to Gehenna, or up to the Throne, He travels the fastest who travels alone.
author: Rudyard Kipling

title: Without a family, man, alone in the world, trembles with the cold.
author: Andre Maurois

title: As long as you keep going, you'll keep getting better. And as you get better, you gain more confidence. That alone is success.
author: Tamara Taylor

title: The hours I spend with you I look upon as sort of a perfumed garden, a dim twilight, and a fountain singing to it. You and you alone make me feel that I am alive. Other men it is said have seen angels, but I have seen thee and thou art enough.
author: George Edward Moore

title: Always vote for principle, though you may vote alone, and you may cherish the sweetest reflection that your vote is never lost.
author: John Quincy Adams

title: There's a natural law of karma that vindictive people, who go out of their way to hurt others, will end up broke and alone.
author: Sylvester Stallone

title: I used to think that the worst thing in life was to end up alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is to end up with people who make you feel alone.
author: Robin Williams

title: We are all born alone and die alone. The loneliness is definitely part of the journey of life.
author: Jenova Chen

title: There is a destiny which makes us brothers; none goes his way alone. All that we send into the lives of others comes back into our own.
author: Edwin Markham

title: True love is not a strong, fiery, impetuous passion. It is, on the contrary, an element calm and deep. It looks beyond mere externals, and is attracted by qualities alone. It is wise and discriminating, and its devotion is real and abiding.
author: Ellen G. White

title: The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

title: I was a queen, and you took away my crown; a wife, and you killed my husband; a mother, and you deprived me of my children. My blood alone remains: take it, but do not make me suffer long.
author: Marie Antoinette

title: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
author: Swami Vivekananda

title: The strong man is strongest when alone.
author: Friedrich Schiller

title: What a child can do in cooperation today, he can do alone tomorrow.
author: Lev Vygotsky

title: You are capable of more than you know. Choose a goal that seems right for you and strive to be the best, however hard the path. Aim high. Behave honorably. Prepare to be alone at times, and to endure failure. Persist! The world needs all you can give.
author: E. O. Wilson

title: We're all going to die, all of us; what a circus! That alone should make us love each other, but it doesn't. We are terrorized and flattened by trivialities. We are eaten up by nothing.
author: Charles Bukowski

title: God writes the Gospel not in the Bible alone, but also on trees, and in the flowers and clouds and stars.
author: Martin Luther

title: I always tell young people to hold on to their dreams. And sometimes you have to stand up for what you think is right even if you have to stand alone.
author: Claudette Colvin

title: I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do. I am free, no matter what rules surround me. If I find them tolerable, I tolerate them; if I find them too obnoxious, I break them. I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

title: Our future cannot depend on the government alone. The ultimate solutions lie in the attitudes and the actions of the American people.
author: Joe Biden

title: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
author: Yoko Ono

title: The story of 'Mr. Robot' is really about this guy who's lonely - who's alone and feels so disconnected from the world.
author: Sam Esmail

title: It's better to be healthy alone than sick with someone else.
author: Phil McGraw

title: Understand that everybody has their own struggles, regardless of whether you can see it or not. Just surround yourself with the people who love you, and know you're not really alone.
author: Molly Tarlov

title: I'm never less at leisure than when at leisure, or less alone than when alone.
author: Scipio Africanus

title: And if you don't believe the sun will rise, stand alone and greet the coming night in the last remaining light.
author: Chris Cornell

title: I think it's very healthy to spend time alone. You need to know how to be alone and not be defined by another person.
author: Olivia Wilde

title: Your grief path is yours alone, and no one else can walk it, and no one else can understand it.
author: Terri Irwin

title: Loneliness expresses the pain of being alone and solitude expresses the glory of being alone.
author: Paul Tillich

title: Many a sin has sullied me in body and in soul because I did not restrain my thoughts nor guard my lips: nevertheless it is to Thee, O God of majesty and love, that I turn in my extremity, for Thou art the fount of mercy; to Thee, as quickly as I may, I speed: for Thou alone canst heal me; I take refuge under Thy protection.
author: Saint Ambrose

title: I'm learning a lot about myself being alone, and doing what I'm doing.
author: Chantal Kreviazuk

title: I was born by myself but carry the spirit and blood of my father, mother and my ancestors. So I am really never alone. My identity is through that line.
author: Ziggy Marley

title: Every person remembers some moment in their life where they witnessed some injustice, big or small, and looked away because the consequences of intervening seemed too intimidating. But there's a limit to the amount of incivility and inequality and inhumanity that each individual can tolerate. I crossed that line. And I'm no longer alone.
author: Edward Snowden

title: Not drunk is he who from the floor - Can rise alone and still drink more; But drunk is They, who prostrate lies, Without the power to drink or rise.
author: Thomas Love Peacock

title: The golden opportunity you are seeking is in yourself. It is not in your environment; it is not in luck or chance, or the help of others; it is in yourself alone.
author: Orison Swett Marden

title: Man cannot live by bread alone; he must have peanut butter.
author: James A. Garfield

title: You can't change the world alone - you will need some help - and to truly get from your starting point to your destination takes friends, colleagues, the good will of strangers and a strong coxswain to guide them.
author: William H. McRaven

title: We don't accomplish anything in this world alone... and whatever happens is the result of the whole tapestry of one's life and all the weavings of individual threads form one to another that creates something.
author: Sandra Day O'Connor

title: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
author: Aeschylus

title: It is never too late to strengthen the foundation of faith. There is always time. With faith in the Savior, you can repent and plead for forgiveness. There is someone you can forgive. There is someone you can thank. There is someone you can serve and lift. You can do it wherever you are and however alone and deserted you may feel.
author: Henry B. Eyring

title: The time you spend alone with God will transform your character and increase your devotion. Then your integrity and godly behavior in an unbelieving world will make others long to know the Lord.
author: Charles Stanley

title: A hospital alone shows what war is.
author: Erich Maria Remarque

title: Reason is not automatic. Those who deny it cannot be conquered by it. Do not count on them. Leave them alone.
author: Ayn Rand

title: Never trust a man, who when left alone with a tea cosey... Doesn't try it on.
author: Billy Connolly

title: When we dream alone it is only a dream, but when many dream together it is the beginning of a new reality.
author: Friedensreich Hundertwasser

title: Don't let the past steal your present. This is the message of Christmas: We are never alone.
author: Taylor Caldwell

title: I tend to stay up late, not because I'm partying but because it's the only time of the day when I'm alone and don't have to be performing.
author: Jim Carrey

title: Being alone with fear can rapidly turn into panic. Being alone with frustration can rapidly turn into anger. Being alone with disappointment can rapid turn into discouragement and, even worse, despair.
author: Mark Goulston

title: In a world that is constantly changing, there is no one subject or set of subjects that will serve you for the foreseeable future, let alone for the rest of your life. The most important skill to acquire now is learning how to learn.
author: John Naisbitt

title: The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary; men alone are quite capable of every wickedness.
author: Joseph Conrad

title: Our uniqueness makes us special, makes perception valuable - but it can also make us lonely. This loneliness is different from being 'alone': You can be lonely even surrounded by people. The feeling I'm talking about stems from the sense that we can never fully share the truth of who we are. I experienced this acutely at an early age.
author: Amy Tan

title: Leadership is the other side of the coin of loneliness, and he who is a leader must always act alone. And acting alone, accept everything alone.
author: Ferdinand Marcos

title: We enter the world alone, we leave the world alone.
author: James Anthony Froude

title: Happiness is spiritual, born of truth and love. It is unselfish; therefore it cannot exist alone, but requires all mankind to share it.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

title: No dream is ever chased alone.
author: Rahul Dravid

title: Doing the right thing is a decision, which in many cases means you stand alone.
author: Sebastian Kurz

title: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
author: Helen Keller

title: None of us got to where we are alone. Whether the assistance we received was obvious or subtle, acknowledging someone's help is a big part of understanding the importance of saying thank you.
author: Harvey Mackay

title: I rise to taste the dawn, and find that love alone will shine today.
author: Ken Wilber

title: Only through repentance and faith in Christ can anyone be saved. No religious activity will be sufficient, only true faith in Jesus Christ alone.
author: Ravi Zacharias

title: One of the greatest attacks of the enemy is to make you busy, to make you hurried, to make you noisy, to make you distracted, to fill the people of God and the Church of God with so much noise and activity that there is no room for prayer. There is no room for being alone with God. There is no room for silence. There is no room for meditation.
author: Paul Washer

title: I could prove God statistically. Take the human body alone - the chances that all the functions of an individual would just happen is a statistical monstrosity.
author: George Gallup

title: In the absence of any other proof, the thumb alone would convince me of God's existence.
author: Isaac Newton

title: I was sleeping the other night, alone, thanks to the exterminator.
author: Emo Philips

title: No man is an island. No man stands alone.
author: Dennis Brown

title: Art makes us feel less alone. It makes us think: somebody else has thought this, somebody else has had these feelings.
author: Alan Moore

title: Solitude is strength; to depend on the presence of the crowd is weakness. The man who needs a mob to nerve him is much more alone than he imagines.
author: Paul Brunton

title: My dad grew up in a mud hut and studied by candlelight. He was 14 when he got a scholarship to Russia. He was super clever - the cleverest person. He landed in 5ft of snow, and was alone at 14, studying science and engineering. He didn't have a bed, and he slept on a table.
author: M.I.A.

title: Mental prayer in my opinion is nothing else than an intimate sharing between friends; it means taking time frequently to be alone with Him who we know loves us. The important thing is not to think much but to love much and so do that which best stirs you to love. Love is not great delight but desire to please God in everything.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

title: Earth teach me to forget myself as melted snow forgets its life. Earth teach me resignation as the leaves which die in the fall. Earth teach me courage as the tree which stands all alone. Earth teach me regeneration as the seed which rises in the spring.
author: William Alexander

title: To sit alone in the lamplight with a book spread out before you, and hold intimate converse with men of unseen generations - such is a pleasure beyond compare.
author: Kenko Yoshida

title: An artist is always alone - if he is an artist. No, what the artist needs is loneliness.
author: Henry Miller

title: The light of lights looks always on the motive, not the deed, the shadow of shadows on the deed alone.
author: William Butler Yeats

title: Marriage is good for those who are afraid to sleep alone at night.
author: St. Jerome

title: It is the fight alone that pleases us, not the victory.
author: Blaise Pascal

title: But in the end, in the end one is alone. We are all of us alone. I mean I'm told these days we have to consider ourselves as being in society... but in the end one knows one is alone, that one lives at the heart of a solitude.
author: Harold Bloom

title: Give me one hundred preachers who fear nothing but sin and desire nothing but God, and I care not whether they be clergymen or laymen, they alone will shake the gates of Hell and set up the kingdom of Heaven upon Earth.
author: John Wesley

title: Words and pictures can work together to communicate more powerfully than either alone.
author: William Albert Allard

title: Your life is yours and yours alone. Rise up and live it.
author: Terry Goodkind

title: People need to know that they are not alone, that they have not been abandoned; but that there is One Who loves them for what they are, Who cares about them.
author: Dada Vaswani

title: Human beings do not live in the objective world alone, nor alone in the world of social activity as ordinarily understood, but are very much at the mercy of the particular language which has become the medium of expression for their society.
author: Edward Sapir

title: I have always preferred to keep things to myself rather than sharing them with anyone, but I am learning that if you let it go, you feel better for it. Don't keep it all bottled up inside; don't take it all on alone.
author: Luis Suarez

title: There is no health without mental health; mental health is too important to be left to the professionals alone, and mental health is everyone's business.
author: Vikram Patel

title: I was born to be alone, and I always shall be; but now I want to be.
author: Mary MacLane

title: Success doesn't necessarily come from breakthrough innovation but from flawless execution. A great strategy alone won't win a game or a battle; the win comes from basic blocking and tackling.
author: Naveen Jain

title: Associate yourself with people of good quality, for it is better to be alone than in bad company.
author: Booker T. Washington

title: Justice cannot be for one side alone, but must be for both.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

title: When you are a mother, you are never really alone in your thoughts. A mother always has to think twice, once for herself and once for her child.
author: Sophia Loren

title: I found that with depression, one of the most important things you could realise is that you're not alone.
author: Dwayne Johnson

title: We're all alone in this world.
author: Gillian Jacobs

title: If I want to be alone, some place I can write, I can read, I can pray, I can cry, I can do whatever I want - I go to the bathroom.
author: Alicia Keys

title: The foolish and the dead alone never change their opinions.
author: James Russell Lowell

title: Ants can live together in solidarity and forget themselves in the community. In a normative capitalist society, everyone is an egoist. In the ants' civilization, you are part of the group; you don't live for yourself alone.
author: Bernard Werber

title: Freedom is the sure possession of those alone who have the courage to defend it.
author: Pericles

title: One of my favorite things to do is to play music really loud and dance my butt off in the morning. I'll do it alone in my apartment. You can't have a bad day after that.
author: Allison Williams

title: Eagles commonly fly alone. They are crows, daws, and starlings that flock together.
author: John Webster

title: Life is only a long and bitter suicide, and faith alone can transform this suicide into a sacrifice.
author: Franz Liszt

title: A man is rich in proportion to the number of things he can afford to let alone.
author: Henry David Thoreau

title: The object of oratory alone in not truth, but persuasion.
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay
